Posts.Title: Just need to get it off my chest. hawklin hawklin

Posts.Content: hawklin wrote: No pun intended. :) I've had a lump on my breast for a few years now and I've completely ignored it because I was a breastfeeding mom and thought it was just one of those things. It's been about 5 months since I stopped breastfeeding and the lump has not gone away so I finally scheduled an appt. to have it looked at. My GP felt the lump that is kind of in the under arm area and I also have swollen lymph nodes in both arm pits. Course of action for now is blood work, ultrasound of said lump as well as a CT scan of my chest and neck and then I have a referral to a breast specialist aka surgeon for what course of action we will take after I have the scans done. I was told to wait to schedule my scans until he gets my blood work back. I just want answers. The only thing I can think of is that my youngest daughter is only 3 and if it's cancer and I die now she'll never remember me and it breaks my heart. And also that I should have gone to the dr. a long time ago. :( Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just need to get it off my chest. hawklin hawklin

Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2013 09:20PM hawklin wrote: I go for my scans on Monday morning after playing phone tag all day. That's helped my anxiety a bit for now, knowing I have a date to start getting some answers.
Posts.Title: Just need to get it off my chest. hawklin hawklin

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2013 03:06PM hawklin wrote: Well the ultrasound showed a small mass with nice smooth edges. The radiologist came in and talked to me. He said most of the masses like mine are benign but the only way to know for sure is to biopsy. The CT scan came back normal. So I guess it's promising news although my doctor called sounding concerned about the solid mass and we need to follow up with the breast specialist and do the biopsy. I'm going to try and keep the radiologists upbeat opinion in my head rather than the grave tone of my gp.

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2013 07:05AM hawklin wrote: So I had my biopsy a few weeks ago and all came back benign. I had my follow up today and the Dr said that the results were undefinitive and although the tests were benign he still can't say what it is so now I have to have surgery next month so he can tell me without a doubt that it is not cancerous. I'm confident that it's not but I still have to be stressed about surgery. I just want to put this all behind me already and every appt. just seems to lead to another appt. :(
